intro: Lepidium basuticum, commonly known as the Basutu cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous species. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are often lobed or divided. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Lepidium basuticum is also valued for its edible leaves, which have a peppery flavor similar to mustard greens.
